body_html: (This is probably more suited as a Stack Overflow question...) If you write your input pipeline using tf.contrib.data, you can use the Dataset.filter() method to skip records based on a user-defined predicate.
body_text: (This is probably more suited as a Stack Overflow question...) If you write your input pipeline using tf.contrib.data, you can use the Dataset.filter() method to skip records based on a user-defined predicate.
body: (This is probably more suited as a Stack Overflow question...) If you write your input pipeline using `tf.contrib.data`, you can use the [`Dataset.filter()`](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/contrib/data/Dataset#filter) method to skip records based on a user-defined predicate.
